author: Staff Reporter
text:
The auditorium where the University’s 11th convocation was held on Monday.- Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

In its 14 years of existence, the Thiruvalluvar University conducted its annual convocation for the first time on its own campus at Serkadu on Monday. In fact, the university’s newly appointed Vice Chancellor, K. Murugan, in his annual report, noted this as being one of the highlights of the convocation. “For the first time, this convocation of the university is being conducted in the university premises,” he said.

Other colleges

In previous years, the convocation has been held in the auditoriums of the Christian Medical College, Bagayam and Auxilium College in Gandhi Nagar,

A. Amuldoss, registrar of the university said. The university was established in October 2002.

On Monday, 137 candidates received their degrees in person from Governor K. Rosaiah at the convocation held in the university's recently constructed auditorium. Another 36,552 candidates were awarded degrees in absentia.

The auditorium with a seating capacity of 300 was constructed with funds from the Member of Parliament Local Area Development scheme at a cost of Rs. 80 lakh.
title: Convocation held on varsity campus for first time
